article: My little son Logan had cerebral palsy . I should thank Tri-North Buiders, in which I was working, for  taking care of  him. Four years ago, Tri-North Buiders  _  a daycare center called Little Buiders Day School. Little Buiders had 10  _  ranging in age from 6 weeks to 5 years, with three full-time teachers and a part-time teacher  helping out  there. All the four teachers helped Logan with his daily  _  , including feeding, walking and playing.  _  Logan couldn't speak, the teachers  _  with him through pictures. Logan was then  _  in all activities, such as art projects, plays, field trips, ect . Many things were centered  _  Logan. Later, when Logan recovered to be almost like a  _  child and was preparing for his transition(,)to the public school, the daycare workers worked with the school to ensure a(n)  _  transition. Not only was Logan  _  by the school, but the non-disabled children there were not surprised by Logan's special  _  , which made Little Builders a perfect place to help today's children  get along with  people like Logan. I used to spend a lot of time in the daycare center. When Logan first began to learn to eat, he  _  ate with me or his father around . It was not  _  for me to carry Logan about while feeding him. I know that Logan would not be doing as  _  as he does now if not  _  Tri-North Buiders Company. In a world of making money at all  _  , I think you should know about the company making a(n)  _
